name: Embassy Suites Philadelphia - Airport

reviews.title: A good place to stay if you have an early flight
reviews.text: We stayed here the night before our flight to Lake Tahoe. Just about everything was of a positive nature. The staff is friendly and approchable. The nightly reception was good. Chilli and meatballs were served along with the drinks. There is a restaurant in the hotel which we did not use. We walked down to the Ruby Tuesdays which is close by next to the Hampton Inn. We had an early flight out so we missed the breakfast, but there were some wrapped danishes and juice to be had at an early hour. We left our car at the hotel and all was well with it when we returned. The hotel provides shuttle service to the airport as well as pick-up when you return. You must call them when you return and be sure to wait at area 4 which is the hotel area shuttle pick-up area. We returned at 1 A.M. and two calls were needed before we were picked up. My only complaint is that more attention should be paid to the grout in the tub shower area. There was some obvious mold growing on it in places. This is a problem that I find in almost all hotels regardless of the price range. There is no substitute for an old toothbrush and a little elbow grease. I would stay here again if I had an early flight and required secure parking for my car while I was away.

As frequent Embassy visitors throughout the country, we expected certain things when we scheduled our week long stay at this one and were pleased with almost everything. The room itself was clean, although the outside shower curtain was very dirty and had to request a clean one twice before it was replaced. There was a 3 inch hole in the bathroom wall above the blowdryer and the tissue box cover had different colors of what we guessed to be nail polish on it. It should have been tossed and replaced but was overlooked. There is a little sign posted in the room to not remove towels if going to the pool as there are towels there. Each day this worked fine, until Friday night. That night my girls had to get wrist bands from the front desk before they could get in the pool and they were not allowed to take the towels out of the pool room after swimming which ment they had to walk (no running!) through the freezing lobby during the managers happy hour in only their bathing suits. I was not pleased so I spoke with the manager who said all the right things but didn't fix the problem. They attempted to stop my girls from leaving the pool with the towels the next day but I was there this time so they DID get to wear them through the lobby this day. I'm still not sure I would stay at this Embassy again or not...ALSO We took a trip advisor suggestion and we bypassed going to Six Flags in NJ for Hershey and had a great time!! It was not all geared for little ones. They had great roller coasters for the older kids and adults. Iit was clean and we felt safe. DEFINATELY a great tip!!!! Thank you!!!
reviews.title: As Embassy's go, this one was ok

reviews.text: The Good: Very convenient to Phila. airport and I-95. The made-to-order omeletes were very good. The bed was comfortable. Plenty of clean towels and washcloths.
reviews.title: Once Was Enough

reviews.text: The Bad: The area where the hotel is located is in a marginal neighborhood with what appeared to be a low-end hotel next door. The suites need to be vacuumed more thoroughly (don't walk in the suites barefoot!). Street and highway noise can be problematic if your room faces the highway or Bartram Ave.
reviews.title: Grea hotel, fantastic breafast

reviews.text: The Ugly: At the breakfast buffet there were no styrofoam cups to take coffee out; no jams or jellies; no bananas; no juice glasses. They were using coffee mugs for every type of beverage including water. There simply were no glasses. The staff told me it was because the person responsible "just didn't do an inventory to order the items. We don't know when the items will be here".
reviews.title: OK hotel, needs help

reviews.text: One time here was enough. I'll stay elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: This is a dump

reviews.text: Hotel room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast was great, lots of good food. Only problem was when we checked in, hotel clerk was friendly enough, but did not know some of the answers about parking. (she was in training) We had the park and fly plan, asked upon check in if we needed a sticker or something for our dash, was told no, nothing needed, no liscence plate info, nothing, was feeling uneasy about this, so next morning prior to being shuttled to airport, checked with morning desk clerk, and was told that we needed a litle sticker for dash, or car could have been towed. Other then the parking experience, it was a great motel.
reviews.title: Poor customer service

reviews.text: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Philadelphia Airport May 15 - May 17 for a business conference. The hotel lobby is spectacular with an Atrium and Koi pond. The rooms are bigger than Manhattan studio apts. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (until our last day)
reviews.title: Okay, but major issues

likes.liked: — Breakfast Buffet, Manager Reception (happy hour drinks), room

reviews.text: Major issues: My traveling partner and I went to the bar (Embassy Grille) upon arrival on the 15th and a security guard was training a rookie "first night on the job" he said. At breakfast the next morning, there was alot of chatter about cars being broken into. Come to find out that several cars in the parking lot had their windows busted out including one of my collegues. There was no kind of reaction by the hotel staff to notify the guests or rectify the problem, as I went out to check my car during lunch at 1pm. My car was fine but the row behind mine was littered with glass and there was a SUV still parked with its window busted out and the glass on the floor so obviously no one had bothered to come to the lot to check on guets cars and they have the nerve to have a sign denouncing any responsibility for your car (I have two lawyers who will dispute that claim successfully).
reviews.title: Room was nice but customer service was questionable

reviews.text: There seems to be alot of water damage in the bathrooms as I saw the wallpaper bubbling up whenever the water came on in the room above me (I stayed on the second floor) and it was apparent in Room 112 which was turned into the mens room during our last day to accomodate the amount of women that arrived for a conference for another company. When this company arrived, all other guests became second class citizens. My company actually had to go get our own food and bring it to our meeting room to eat and then clean up after ourselves. All other amenities that we enjoyed prior were taken away.
reviews.title: Disappointing - Run down

likes.liked: — Location to airport and shuttle service

reviews.title: Ok for Park & Fly
reviews.text: Overall this would not have been a hotel that I would stay for a vacation or otherwise but since I have no chose for business trips, I guess its okay for 2 days. I will however recommend that my company utilize the Marriott (as they actually dropped off some collegues that flew, from the airport when Embassy would not) if we come to Philly again.

reviews.title: Ok for park and fly
reviews.text: I enjoyed the room, which was nice, and the breakfast, which was above average. What was rather disappointing was being left stranded at the stadium after the ball game. One of the lobby staff was very enthusiastic and helpful the night before recommending and giving us a ride to a local restaurant. When we mentioned that we were going to the ballgame the next night he promised to shuttle us there and pick us up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed and the Embassy Suites one night in November (2006).
reviews.title: Embassy Suites - Pros & Cons

likes.liked: — The comfy bed and quietness of the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Embassy OK

reviews.text: The Room - Quiet, comfortable and spacious. The bed with six fluffy white pillows was awesome. I slept better than ever. To my surprise, the suite had a microwave and refrigerator.
reviews.title: Pleasant

likes.liked: — Large Suite, Plenty of Room, Happy Hour

reviews.text: Breakfast - The complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast was wonderful.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Embassy....

description: All suites hotel conveniently located one mile from Philadelphia International Airport, with easy access to I-95, I-76, I476 and the New Jersey Turnpike. 5 minutes to PPL Park home of pro soccer and the Philadelphia Union. 8 minutes from Harrah's Casino in Chester, PA.
